title: My child\'s school bus stops to unload at a 4-way stop intersection within my neighborhood. This afternoon, while the bus was unloading, I witnessed a vehicle coming from the opposite direction, stop at the stop sign but then proceed to turn left in front of the schools bus, almost running down children. How is the school bus passing law interpreted in a case like this?
text:
In this case, from what you've described, it appears the driver
violated common sense -- and the law. We can't find any such specific
clause, but if this kind of case went to court, we're certain the
judge would say this violated the law -- and anyone with half a brain
would likely agree.
